column1: Criteo announces fourth quarter and fiscal year 2017 results. CEO Eric Eichmann comments on results and outlook. Watch video interview and read transcript: Criteo (NASDAQ: CRTO) the leader in commerce marketing.
column2: Doll: "The probability of the worst is not real high in the market's view" The Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq were up for the third day in a row on Thursday. Doll said a negotiation with China was more likely than an ongoing tit-for-tat tariff exchange. He attributed the trade actions to Trump's "Art of the Deal" negotiating style.
column3: Sequential Brands Group, Inc. will issue financial results for its first quarter ended before the market opens on Wednesday, . Management will provide further commentary on the Company's financial results on a conference call at 8:30am ET that day. To join the conference call, please dial (877) 407-0789 or visit the investor relations page on the company's website:
column4: Ashley J. Jericho has over nine years of insolvency experience. She has represented consumer and business debtors, creditors and trustees in bankruptcy proceedings. Jericho can be reached at ajericho@mcdonaldhopkins.com or 248.593.2945 X1945.About McDonald Hopkins: McDonald Hopkins is a business advisory and advocacy law firm with locations in Chicago, Cleveland, Columbus, Detroit, Miami and West Palm Beach.
column5: Paychex declared a regular quarterly dividend of $.50 per share payable to shareholders of record . Backed by 45 years of industry expertise, Paychex serves approximately 605,000 payroll clients as of across more than 100 locations and pays one out of every 12 American private sector employees. Learn more at paychex.com and stay connected on Twitter and LinkedIn.
column6: Viavi Solutions Inc. (VIAV) reported a fiscal third-quarter loss of $8.7 million. The San Jose, California-based company said it had a loss of 4 cents. The communications equipment company posted revenue of $219.4 million in the period. For the current quarter ending in June, Viav Solutions expects its per-share earnings to range from 8 cents to 12 cents.
column7: The Board of Directors of CDK Global, Inc. has declared a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.15 per share. The dividend is payable on to shareholders of record at the close of business on . With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries.
column8: Five Prime Therapeutics Inc. (FPRX) lost $20.4 million in its first quarter. The South San Francisco, California-based company said it had a loss of 63 cents per share. The biotech company that develops treatments targeting cancer and autoimmune diseases posted revenue of $32.5 million in the period. Shares have declined 23 percent since the beginning of the year.
column9: Visual Capitalist and Thermosoft analyzed data from 2,000 Americans in order to learn what "making it" meant to them. Americans think an annual income of $147,104 means you've made it. Survey respondents earn an average of $57,426 and spend 17 minutes traveling to work. Just 46 percent of respondents are married with kids, according to the survey. The infographic shows how other Americans define success and how they are doing now.
column10: Cox Industries announced today that it has formally completed the acquisition of certain assets of Langdale Forest Products. Langdale is one of the Southeast's largest wood utility pole manufacturers. The acquisition includes both the purchase of Langley production facilities in Sweetwater, Tennessee and certain other operating agreements related to Langdale's facilities in Valdosta, Georgia and Chauncey, Georgia."We are very pleased to have consummated this acquisition between both of our companies," said Cox Industries CEO
column11: Federal Reserve Bank of New York President William Dudley will speak Thursday morning. The meeting will analyst the current economic conditions in Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands in the aftermath of Hurricanes Irma and Maria last year. Dudley is scheduled to join a panel of economists to answer questions after the presentation. Last week, Puerto Rico's Gov. Ricardo Rossello told CNBC he had a revised fiscal plan for the island.
column12: David Hogg calls for boycott of Vanguard and BlackRock, two of the world's biggest investors in gunmakers. Hogg survived the shooting at a Florida high school in February that left 17 people dead. He and fellow classmates have led a nationwide protest movement over gun violence. BlackRock recently said it had created new funds that would exclude those stocks for investors that wanted to avoid owning them.
column13: Hortonworks Inc. (HDP) on Tuesday reported a loss of $42.1 million in its first quarter. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The business software company posted revenue of $79.1million in the period. For the current quarter ending in July, Hortonworks said it expects revenue in the range of $80 million. The stock has risen 88 percent in the last 12 months.
column14: China announced on Wednesday a 25 percent levy on $50 billion in U.S. imports. The move was in response to Washington's decision to impose a similar scale hike on Chinese goods. The Chinese are looking "where could they have an impact with many people who may have the ear of President Trump ... the farmers are certainly that," said Jim Sutter, CEO of the U.s. Soybean Export Council.
column15: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire says he will take legal action against Google and Apple for abusive business practices. The move that could result in fines of "several million euros" LeMaire accused the companies of imposing tariffs on developers wishing to sell their apps to the internet giants. He added he finds unacceptable that both companies can also gather data from the developers and "unilaterally modify contracts"
column16: Slate Office REIT (TSX:SOT.UN) announced today that it has entered into a definitive agreement to sell 135 Queens Plate Drive in Etobicoke, ON for $16.74 million. The REIT expects to initially use the net proceeds to reduce outstanding debt, which may be redrawn to fund future acquisition activity. This transaction is expected to close in the third quarter of 2018.
column17: John Hennessy replaces Eric Schmidt who announced he was stepping down in Dec. Schmidt will remain as a "technical advisor" to Alphabet. Shirley M. Tilghman will also retire from the board effective Feb. 15, 2018.Hennessy is a former president of Stanford University and has had an extensive career in the tech industry. He has been on the board since 2004 and Lead Independent Director since 2007.
column18: Simon will release financial and operational results for the quarter ending . The Company will host its quarterly earnings conference call and an audio webcast on April 27 at 8:30 a.m. Eastern Time. The live webcast will be available in listen-only mode at investors.simon.com. The call will also be archived for approximately 90 days on the company's website.
column19: Nicholas J. De Blouw is a member of the Employment and Consumer Class Action group at Blumenthal Nordrehaug Bhowmik Deblouw LLP. His practice area focuses on complex class actions brought on behalf of employees and consumers against large companies. He has experience with a variety of employment issues, including wage and hour class actions, wrongful termination, unpaid commission wages, and violations of The Fair Credit Reporting Act.
column20: Swiss Re said it's in talks with Softbank about a "potential minority investment" The Japanese investment conglomerate is eyeing a stake in Swiss Re that could be worth as much as $10 billion. Softbank could ultimately purchase up to a third of Swiss Re's shares, the Wall Street Journal reported. The Swiss company sells insurance to insurers, which fits with SoftBank's previous investments in ride-sharing companies like Uber.
column21: Lego is to make some of its pieces from sustainable, plant-based plastic. The material will be sourced from sugarcane and production of the pieces has already started. The new pieces are to be made from a flexible, soft and durable plastic called polyethylene. Lego is targeting zero waste in operations and has committed to use sustainable materials by 2030. The business is also a member of the RE100, a global initiative made up of some of world's biggest companies.
column22: Kanak Jha is currently a business news associate at CNBC. She attended the CNBC Workshop at AAJA. Jha: "The workshop was the first place where I learned about all the different rotations you can do in the program and it was actually really immersive and very interactive. We talked to a lot of business veterans and leaders in the industry and we also got to do a simulation that showed us how the newsroom works here"
column23: Samsung unveiled its new Exynos 9 Series 9810 processor on Thursday. The chip may be used in its upcoming Galaxy S9 smartphone. The processor has new artificial intelligence technology that will enable devices to recognize faces. Samsung plans to use the chip in computers and in cars, though it didn't name any specific partners for the latter. Samsung's next phone is expected to be revealed in February.
column24: Caterpillar Inc. has long used a subsidiary in Geneva, Switzerland, to process sales and profits for international orders. The IRS wants the heavy-machinery maker to pay a $2 billion tax bill on that business. The company maintains that its Swiss strategy, which results in an effective tax rate of as low as 4 percent, is legal. No civil or criminal charges have been filed, and the company is "in the process of responding to the government's concerns"
column25: Cambridge Analytica is at the center of a data breach scandal involving Facebook. Channel 4 News carried out an undercover sting of the company and caught top executives suggesting the tactics. The news channel's reporter posed as a representative of a wealthy Sri Lankan family looking to gain political standing. One suggestion was to create the scenario of a sex scandal to discredit opponents. "Send some girls around to the candidate's house," CEO Alexander Nix said.
column26: Jones Lang LaSalle Incorporated (NYSE: JLL) will release its first quarter 2018 results Tuesday, , at approximately 7:30 a.m. Eastern time. A live webcast and teleconference call will be held the same day. The link to the webcast can be accessed at the Investor Relations website, ir.jll.com . The teleconference is available by dialing into one of the following phone numbers: United States callers:
column27: GGP is up more than 7,000 percent since the S&P 500 reached its financial crisis closing bottom on . That makes it the best performer in the benchmark since the bull market began. United Rentals and streaming giant Netflix are the second and third best-performing S-P 500 components. Friday marks the ninth anniversary of the "Haines Bottom" on CNBC.
column28: Turkey's foreign ministry says Greek Cypriots are jeopardizing the stability of the country. It says the Cyprus government is acting like "the sole owner" of the island's natural resources. Italy's ENI, France's TOTAL and the U.S. are licensed to search for hydrocarbons off Cyprus' southern coast. The Turkish government says it will not allow the search to go ahead without its permission.
column29: Teradyne, Inc. will release financial results for the first quarter 2018 on Tuesday, April 24 at 5:00 p.m. Eastern Time (ET) or later. A conference call to discuss first quarter results, along with management's business outlook, will follow. Interested investors should access the webcast at investors.teradyne.com/events-presentations at least five minutes before the call begins.
column30: Marcato Capital Management's Mick McGuire said he wouldn't be surprised to see the price rallying to $60 over the next few years. Key to this view is the successful incorporation of recent acquisition Tembec into the company. The 2017 Tembec purchase combined two high purity cellulose businesses and diversified Rayonier's product offerings with integrated forest products. Specialty cellulose is used in the production in a variety of industries, from chemical thickeners and paint to pharmaceuticals.
column31: Mack-Cali Realty Corporation will release its first quarter 2018 earnings results after the market close on Wednesday, . The Company will host a first quarter earnings conference call with management on Thursday, at 10:00 a.m., Eastern Time. The live conference call can be listened to via the Internet by accessing the Company's website at
column32: Creditors lead effort to sell Brazil's Odebrecht rail unit-sources. Creditors pressured the corruption-ensnared group to accelerate asset sales. Banco BTG Pactual SA as an adviser months ago to sell Supervia, the sources said. But failure to reach an agreement with potential acquirers made creditors interfere and transfer the mandate to their investment banking units.
column33: Andiamo Corporation is in talks with a US based Telecommunications Company with the aim of securing an acquisition or merger in the near future. While talks are in their preliminary stages, the outlook is promising and could lead to a further diversification of Utopya's telecommunications market share.Safe Harbor Act: This release includes made pursuant to the safe harbor provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995 that involves risks and uncertainties.
column34: Gray Television, Inc. will host a conference call to discuss its operating results for the quarter ended on Tuesday, . The call will begin at 10:00 a.m. Eastern Time. The live dial-in number is 1-888-516-2443 and the confirmation code is 3100808. The taped replay of the conference call will be available at 1-800-203-1112.
column35: The private equity arm of Cohen's firm invested an undisclosed amount in Imperative Execution. Imperative's CEO, Roman Ginis, is a former trader for Cohen, learning first-hand how high-frequency traders can chip away at profits. Other electronic trading sites have sprouted up to combat high frequency trading, including IEX, or Investors Exchange. The Stamford, Conn., company aims to start trading in May.
column36: ParkOhio (NASDAQ: PKOH) announces the following webcast. The call will be held on Wednesday, , at 10:00 a.m. ET. ParkOhio is a diversified international company providing world class customers with a supply chain management outsourcing service. Headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio, ParkOhio operates more than 125 manufacturing sites and supply chain logistics facilities.
column37: Quarterhill Inc. announced that all of management's nominees listed in its management proxy circular were elected as directors of the Company. Quarterhill also confirmed that shareholders approved the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Company's auditors and Quarterhill's 2018 Equity Incentive Plan. The detailed results of the vote for the election of directors held at the Annual Meeting are set out below.
column38: OCI Partners LP will announce its 2018 first quarter results on Monday, at 6:30 a.m. ET. The Partnership will hold its results conference call on , at 10:00 a.M. ET, during which senior management will review the Partnership's financial results for the period. Callers may listen to the live presentation, which will be followed by a question and answer segment, by dialing (816) 287-56
column39: The Irvine, California-based company said it had a loss of $5.22 per share. The provider of marketing services for automakers and dealers posted revenue of $33.3 million. Shares of AutoWeb have decreased 22 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Thursday, shares hit $7.05, a decline of 47 percent in the last 12 months.
column40: Universal Electronics Inc. (UEIC) on Thursday reported a fourth-quarter loss of $16.9 million. The Santa Ana, California-based company said it had a lost of $1.19 per share. The results met Wall Street expectations. For the year, the company reported a loss of $10.3 million, or 72 cents per share, swinging to a loss in the period.
column41: Rowley Law PLLC is investigating potential claims against GGP Inc. and its board of directors for breach of fiduciary duty. The proposed acquisition of the company by Brookfield Property Partners L.P. is valued at approximately $9.25 billion. Stockholders will receive either $23.50 or one unit of Brookfield common stock or a new Brookfield U.S. REIT security for each share of GGP stock that they hold.
column42: China says US approach on trade sets bad precedent, may trigger domino effect. The ministry warned that a unilateral trade approach could trigger a domino Effect. A U.S. 301 probe on China was a blatant violation of World Trade Organization rules, Gao Feng said. China hopes the United States could take measures and resolve the conflicts through dialogue and hoped trade relations between the two countries could return to normal.
column43: The Dow fell more than 1,700 points on Friday and Monday, then bounced back with a 567-point gain Tuesday. The Dow rose 130 points in morning trade Wednesday. Friday's Labor Department report indicated a larger-than-expected increase in jobs, along with rising wages. On the surface, this is good news, but to traders worried about an overheating economy triggering inflation and higher interest rates.
column44: The e-commerce giant rose 2.7 percent on Tuesday lifting its stock market value to $768 billion. Apple is now the only company more valuable than Amazon. Amazon has surged 35 percent this year, dwarfing Alphabet's 4 percent gain. Meanwhile, Facebook's slide has dropped its value back below Berkshire Hathaway. Microsoft is the fourth biggest company by market cap, followed by China's Tencent.
column45: The shareholders, which include lead investors Shah Capital, Barington Capital Group and NuOrion Partners, together hold a 3.5 percent stake in the company. The group said they were "extremely disappointed" with the board's inability to address falling shareholder value and to hire a new chief executive quickly. The company's shares have lost nearly 90 percent of their value since Sheri McCoy took charge as CEO in 2012.
column46: Investment entities controlled by billionaire Carl Icahn shed one-third of their stakes in crane maker Manitowoc. The entities sold nearly 940,000 shares at prices ranging from roughly $32 per share to $34 per share. The sales totaled about $31 million. After the trades, Icahn owned 4.85 percent of the company, down from his previous stake of 7.5 percent.
column47: Loews Corporation will report first quarter 2018 financial results on Monday, . A conference call for analysts and investors will begin at 11:00 a.m. ET and will be hosted by the Company's chief executive officer, James S. Tisch, and chief financial officer, David B. Edelson. Loews invites shareholders to submit questions for management in advance of this conference call.
column48: ValueAct Capital Partners has built a $1.2 billion stake in Citigroup. The stake equals about .07 percent of the U.S. bank, according to the Wall Street Journal. ValueAct isn't calling for a strategic shakeup, the report said. The wager on Citigroup is partially based on its treasury services business, the Journal said. It echoes a 2016 investment by ValueAct in shares of Morgan Stanley.
column49: Parker Drilling declares a cash dividend of $1.8125 per share on its 7.25% Series A Mandatory Convertible Preferred Stock. The dividend is for the period beginning on , and ending on . The Company's Drilling Services business serves operators in the inland waters of the U.S. Gulf of Mexico utilizing Parker Drilling's barge rig fleet. The Rental Tools Services business supplies premium equipment and well services to operators
column50: Entegris will release its financial results for the fourth quarter of 2017 before the opening of the market on Tuesday, . A teleconference with management is scheduled for the same day at 9:00 a.m. Eastern Time (ET) Participants are asked to dial in 5 to 10 minutes prior to the start of the call. The call can also be accessed live and on-demand from the Entegris website.
column51: Paulafort did not speak during the Thursday arraignment at a northern Virginia courthouse. A trial date of July 10 has been set, four months earlier than the defense had wanted. The charges are part of Special Counsel Robert Mueller 's investigation into Russian efforts to influence U.S. elections. The grand jury indictment in the Washington suburb of Alexandria, Virginia, accuses him of hiding tens of millions of dollars he earned advising pro-Russia politicians.
column52: Living in San Francisco costs 92.9 percent more than the U.S. average, according to data from Kiplinger. Residing in Manhattan is even worse: It costs 138.6 percent more. Using MIT's living wage calculator, CNBC Make It found the minimum amount necessary to meet basic needs. These numbers account for a family of two adults and one child and don't include conveniences such as restaurant meals.
column53: RF Industries, Ltd. will release financial results for the second quarter ended on Monday, at approximately 8:30 a.m. EDT. RFI has scheduled a conference call that morning at 11:30A.M. EDT to discuss its results. A simultaneous webcast of the conference call can be accessed from the Investor Information page at
column54: Former Walmart.com CEO Carter Cast says store closures will be a marker of strength for Walmart. He predicts an uptick in online sales for the retailer. Cast says there is too much square footage in the retail industry. He says Walmart could still keep much of its U.S. customer base within close range with more store closures. He was on CNBC's "Power Lunch" on Wednesday.
column55: Rogers Corporation (NYSE:ROG) plans to announce fourth quarter and full year 2017 results on February 27 after market close. A live webcast and slide presentation will be available under the investors section of To participate, please dial 1-800-574-8929 from the US, or 1-973-935-8524 from outside the US.
column56: Purcell Julie & Lefkowitz LLP is investigating a potential breach of fiduciary duty claim involving the board of directors of Microsemi Corporation (NASDAQ: MSCC) If you are a shareholder and are interested in obtaining additional information regarding this investigation, free of charge, please visit us at: may also contact Robert H. LefKowitz, Esq. either via email
column57: Marvell announces a quarterly dividend of $0.06 per share of common stock. The dividend is payable on to stockholders of record as of . Marvell first revolutionized the digital storage industry by moving information at speeds never thought possible. With leading intellectual property and deep system-level knowledge, Marvell's semiconductor solutions continue to transform the enterprise, cloud, automotive and industrial markets.
column58: QTS Realty Trust, Inc. will issue its financial results for the quarter ended after market close on Monday, . The Company will conduct a conference call and webcast on Tuesday, at 7:30 a.m. Central time. A link to the live broadcast and the replay will be available on the Company's website under the Investors tab.
column59: Novo Nordisk's oral diabetes drug beats Jardiance in study. The pill would simulate insulin production as part of the company's blockbuster movement to make insulin intake more convenient. The once-daily pill, which Novo hopes to launch in 2020, belongs to a blockbuster class of treatments known as GLP-1s that stimulate insulin production. So far, all have been injections and a pill would offer a step-change in convenience.
column60: Pacific City Financial Corporation (OTC Pink: PFCF) declares a cash dividend on its common share of $0.03 per share. The dividend will be paid on or about , to shareholders of record as of the close of business on . Pacific City Bank specializes in commercial banking for small to medium-size businesses by providing commercial real estate loans, small business loans and lines of credit.
column61: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said he had signed into law a bill renewing the National Security Agency's warrantless internet surveillance program. "Just signed 702 Bill to reauthorize foreign intelligence collection," Trump wrote on Twitter. The law renews for six years and with minimal changes the NSA's program, which gathers information from foreigners overseas but incidentally collects communications belonging to Americans.
column62: Investors should prepare for a large infrastructure plan from the federal government, Morgan Stanley says. The bank's base case suggests a $1.1 trillion package over 10 years. The flood of cash would be designated to rebuild the nation's roads and bridges, drawing upon American machinery and auto manufacturers to help restore the highway system."We see a policy-driven increase in infrastructure spending as likely over time," Morgan Stanley's research team says.
column63: RCI Hospitality Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: RICK) declared a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.03 per common share for the Fiscal 2018 second quarter ending . The 2Q18 dividend is payable , to holders of record March 12,2018, with an ex-dividend date of March 9,2018. This marks the ninth consecutive quarterly cash dividends paid by RCI. With 45 units, RCI Hospital
column64: Lockheed Martin will webcast live its first quarter 2018 earnings results conference call on Tuesday, , at 11:00 a.m. ET. Marillyn Hewson, chairman, president and chief executive officer, and Bruce Tanner, executive vice president, chief financial officer, will discuss financial results. The live webcast and relevant financial charts will be available for download on the Lockheed Martin Investor Relations website,
column65: Alibaba founder Jack Ma says friction between U.S. and China should be expected. He says trade is not simply about goods but about respecting other cultures. Ma said under a good trading relationship, Alibaba can help boost 10 million or even 20 million jobs in the U.K. He added that China's middle class would continue to grow and consume, which could only be a positive for the United States.
column66: Talks between North and South Korea will likely resume after May 25 following completion of joint U.S.-South Korea military drills, a South Korean government spokesperson said. North Korea last week canceled at the last minute a meeting with senior South Korean officials in protest over joint exercises between Seoul and Washington. Yoon Young-chan, a spokesman for the South Korean presidency, was speaking to reporters in Washington following a White House meeting between President Donald Trump and South Korean President Moon Jae-in.
column67: Retrophin Inc. (RTRX) reported a loss of $17.6 million in its fourth quarter. The drug developer posted revenue of $42.2 million in the period. For the year, the company reported that its loss widened to $59.7 million, or $1.54 per share. Retrophin shares have risen 13 percent since the beginning of the year.
column68: Arlington Asset Investment Corp. will release results for the first quarter ended after the market closes on Wednesday, . The Company will hold a conference call for investors at 9:00 A.M. Eastern Time on Thursday, to discuss the results. The conference call will be available via the Internet at:
column69: Chimera Investment Corporation plans to release its financial results for the first quarter 2018 on Thursday, prior to 7:00 a.m. EDT. The Company will conduct a conference call and audio webcast to discuss the results. A replay of the call will be available for one week following the conference call. If you would like to be added to the e-mail distribution list, please visit
column70: JBT Corporation (NYSE: JBT) will report fourth quarter 2017 financial results after the market closes on Monday, . A conference call is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. EST on Tuesday, to discuss the results. The call will be simultaneously webcast on JBT Corporation's Investor Relations website, which can be accessed at .
column71: Boardwalk Pipeline Partners, LP will report its fourth quarter 2017 earnings on Monday, . A conference call for analysts and investors will begin at 9:30 a.m. Eastern Time. The news release and a live webcast will be available online at the Boardwalk website ( ). Please go to the website at least 10 minutes before the event begins to register and to download and install any necessary audio software.
column72: Brandt most recently served as chief brand officer across Bloomin' Brands Outback Steakhouse, Carrabba's, Bonefish Grill and Fleming's. The hiring comes as new Chief Executive Brian Niccol looks to turn around the fortunes of the troubled burrito chain and reclaim some of its lost reputation. Brandt had worked with Niccol at Yum Brands, where he served as the chief brand and marketing officer of Taco Bell.
column73: The U.S. State Department has approved the possible sale of Javelin anti-tank missiles and launch units to Ukraine. The United States said in December it would provide Ukraine with defensive weapons. Ukraine and Russia have been at loggerheads over a war in eastern Ukraine that has killed more than 10,000 people. The Pentagon said in a statement on Thursday the proposed sale would not alter the military balance in the region.
column74: BJ's Wholesale Club is expanding its partnership with Instacart. The wholesale club will offer same-day delivery in cities along the East Coast. The service will expand to all BJ's Clubs nationwide by the end of April. It follows the lead of wholesale retailers Costco and Walmart's Sam's Club, which also recently partnered with Instaart to offer nationwide same- day delivery services.
column75: H&R Block has paid quarterly dividends consecutively since the company went public in 1962. The quarterly cash dividend of 24 cents per share is payable , to shareholders of record as of . In fiscal 2017, H&r Block had annual revenues of over $3 billion with 23 million tax returns prepared worldwide. The company also offers adjacent Tax Plus products and services.
column76: GSI Technology, Inc. will release financial results for its third quarter fiscal 2018 ended at the market close on Thursday . Management will also conduct a conference call to review the Company's financial results. Any investor or interested individual can listen to the teleconference, which is scheduled at 1:30 p.m. Pacific (4:30pm Eastern)
column77: Toys R Us has received court approval to move forward with its plans to shutter about 180 stores. Liquidation sales at those locations are beginning as soon as Wednesday. Closures are set to run through mid-April of this year. The company will also refresh a number of existing locations to be co-branded as Toys R Us and Babies R Us stores, the company said in a statement.
column78: Altice USA will host a conference call on Wednesday, at 4:30 p.m. EDT. The call will discuss financial and operating results for the quarter ended . A live webcast of the presentation will be available on the following website:
column79: Core-Mark Holding Co. (CORE) reported a first-quarter loss of $1.3 million. The South San Francisco, California-based company said it had a loss of 3 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, were 7 cents per cent. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations, also exceeding revenue of $3.81 billion. The stock has fallen 43 percent in the last 12 months.
column80: J.P. Morgan released its latest investing ideas to its clients on Thursday. The bank asks its analysts to select their top three stock picks each month. Six names were added to the analyst focus list while three have been removed since last month."The investment ideas we provide are tailored to these selected strategies and, as such, may vary," analyst Nicholas Rosato Jr. wrote to clients.
column81: Valvoline's board of directors declared a quarterly cash dividend of 7.45 cents per share of Valvoline TM common stock. The dividend is payable on , to shareholders of record as of the close of business on . Visit to learn more about the company and its products. The company is a leading worldwide producer and distributor of premium-branded automotive, commercial and industrial lubricants, and automotive chemicals.
column82: BlackRock declares quarterly cash dividend of $2.88 per share of common stock. Dividend is payable to shareholders of record at the close of business on . As of , the firm manages approximately $6.317 trillion in assets on behalf of investors worldwide. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit
column83: Canada's main stock index slumped to a four-month low on Friday. Natural resource shares led broad based declines as commodity prices dropped. All of the index's 10 main groups were in negative territory. U.S. crude prices were down 1.1 percent at $65.09 a barrel, while Brent crude lost 2 percent to $68.27. The energy group retreated 2.5 percent, and the financials group slipped 1.2 percent.
column84: Cementos Pacasmayo S.A. plans to release Fourth Quarter 2017 Results on Monday, , after the market closes. A live audio webcast of this event will be available at: A replay of the webcast will beavailable at the above link for one year following the call. For more information please visit
column85: Goldcorp Inc. will release its 2017 fourth quarter and full year results after market close on . A conference call and webcast will be held on at 10:00 am PT. The conference call will be available for replay by phone at: 1-800-408-3053 or outside US and Canada at 1-905-694-9451.
column86: More than 277,000 students were out of the classroom for nine instructional days. Thousands of teachers had flooded the state capitol in days of protests in seeking a pay increase. "I stood rock solid on the 5 percent Teacher pay raise and delivered," Republican Governor Jim Jim Jim said on Twitter. The West Virginia Education Association said on its Facebook page: "WE WON!" The state's teachers' pay is near the bottom of the scale for U.S. teachers.
column87: Cate Blanchett called on the world to adopt a more compassionate approach to refugees on Tuesday. The UNHCR goodwill ambassador explained to an audience at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, that not only do refugees need support in the form of nutrition, healthcare and shelter, they also need to be heard. According to UNHCR's Global Trends 2016 report , developing regions hosted 84 percent of the world's refugees under UNHCR's mandate.
column88: Ranger Energy Services, Inc. will report fourth quarter 2017 financial and operating results after the market closes for trading on . Following the announcement, the Company's management will host aFourth quarter 2017 earnings conference call the morning of at 10:00 a.m. Eastern time. A replay of the conference call will be available following the call and can be accessed from .
column89: Mumbai is home to the world's highest-earning expats, according to the latest HSBC Expat Explorer survey. Foreigners working in India's largest city can typically expect to bring home a sizable $217,165 salary. The findings, which are based on feedback from 27,587 expats across the globe, place the subcontinent's financial center ahead of San Francisco.
column90: Tesla Inc. (TSLA) on Wednesday reported a loss of $675.4 million in its fourth quarter. On a per-share basis, the Palo Alto, California-based company said it had a Loss of $4.01. Tesla shares have risen 11 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading, shares hit $345, a climb of 34 percent in the last 12 months.
column91: MedEquities Realty Trust, Inc. declared a common stock dividend of $0.21 per share for the quarter ended . The dividend will be paid in cash on to stockholders of record as of . MedEquities' strategy is to become an integral capital partner with high-quality and growth-oriented facility-based providers of healthcare services.
column92: Elon Musk's SpaceX launched its largest satellite ever into space on Tuesday. It marked the 50th time the company has flown one of its signature Falcon 9 rockets. The payload was a 30W-6 satellite made by Spanish firm Hispasat and was launched from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station, Florida. Musk has been pushing SpaceX to do more regular launches this year and has also expanded its offerings.
column93: Shares of Twitter have run up nearly 50 percent year to date. Facebook's stock gained a little over 30 percent over the same time frame. Shares of Twitter were down roughly 3.5 percent as of 2 p.m. ET on Tuesday, hovering around $34 a share. The company suspended several popular accounts , some with millions of followers, for violating its new anti-spam rules.
column94: China's President Xi Jinping told President Donald Trump in a phone call on Tuesday that the hard-earned easing of tensions on the Korean Peninsula must continue.Unity on the issue was extremely important, Xi said, according to Chinese state broadcaster CCTV. Senior officials from 20 nations will gather in Vancouver on Tuesday for a summit on curbing North Korea's nuclear ambitions, in a bid to increase diplomatic and financial pressure on Pyongyang.
column95: The oil and natural gas company posted revenue of $455 million in the period. For the year, the company reported a loss of $266 million, or $6.26 per share. California Resources shares have risen slightly more than 3 percent since the beginning of the year.. In the final minutes of trading on Monday, shares hit $20.11, a rise of 11 percent in the last year.
column96: Purcell Julie & Lefkowitz LLP is investigating a potential breach of fiduciary duty claim involving the board of directors of Dick's Sporting Goods, Inc. (NYSE: DKS) If you are a shareholder and are interested in obtaining additional information regarding this investigation, please visit us at: may also contact Robert H. LefKowitz, Esq. either via
column97: Simon, a global leader in premier shopping, dining and entertainment destinations, announced today that Andrew Juster, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, will retire at the end of this year. "It has been an honor working with Andy, and I could not have asked for a better partner throughout his long-standing tenure," said David Simon, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. Simon is an S&P 100 company (Simon Property Group, NYSE:SPG).
column98: Kroger considered buying online wholesaler Boxed, according to a person familiar with the matter. The potential deal, which arose as the New York-based startup was seeking funding, likely values Boxed at between $325 million and $500 million. Amazon's $13.7 billion acquisition of Whole Foods Market last year to crack the U.S. grocery market heightened a sense of urgency among rivals.
column99: French plastics maker Novares priced its initial public offering (IPO) at between 6.30-8.00 euros per share. IPO could give it a stock market capitalisation of up to 550 million euros ($686 million) Novares mostly produces plastic items for car interiors, such as door handles, dashboard components or air vents. Trading in Novares shares is expected to start on Feb. 15.
column100: Pentagon says it has uninvited China from a multinational military exercise to be held this summer in the Pacific. It cited what it called "strong evidence" that China has deployed anti-ship missiles, surface-to-air missile systems and electronic jammers to contested areas of the South China Sea. It called on China to remove these systems. The Pentagon also cited its objections to China's recent landing of bomber aircraft at Woody Island.
